meanings.definition: An act or instance of lying in wait to attack by surprise.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers set up an ambushment in the forest to surprise the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The bandits planned an ambushment on the unsuspecting travelers.
meanings.sent3: The cunning fox prepared an ambushment to catch the rabbits off guard.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an ambushment, hiding her true feelings behind a mask of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The ambushment was like a hidden trap, waiting to spring on its unsuspecting prey.

meanings.definition: The act of concealing oneself and lying in wait to attack by surprise.
meanings.sent1: The ninja's ambushment was so stealthy that no one saw him coming.
meanings.sent2: The hunter's ambushment in the bushes caught the deer by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ambushment behind the couch was foiled by a sudden sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was an ambushment, waiting for the perfect moment to strike.
meanings.sent5: The ambushment of shadows in the alley made the night seem full of hidden dangers.
